text: have you ever thought about meditation
you've probably heard that it's
beneficial but how exactly today we're
diving deep into the world of inner
peace once you grasp these facts you'll
be eager to give meditation a shot but
first why should you meditate meditation
is a great practice to help relax your
mind and is even beneficial for your
mental health we all live busy lives
sometimes we never get a break from
working studying or even training as
human beings we don't realize how much
our minds are constantly working or even
worrying but meditation is a chance for
everyone to calm their busy minds and
help towards relieving any stress or
anxiety in 2011 a report showed that
those who practiced meditation had a
decrease in anxiety and increased
psychological well-being if we look at
why scientifically meditation fuels the
mind it's because the stress decreases
in two regions of the brain the amygdala
and the default mode Network or dmn both
these regions are connected to fear and
anxiety so if they're relaxed then
you'll be relaxed too so if your job or
workload is stressing you out meditating
will be able to help calm your nerves
and anxiety meditation doesn't only help
calm the mind but it can also help slow
down your heart rate and blood pressure
too in 2013 a study found that a group
of people who meditate five minutes a
day for 10 days straight had better
timings between each heartbeat compared
to those who didn't meditate and having
this healthy Hearts will lead to a
healthier life being healthy in life
doesn't mean you only have to eat
healthy for your heart to be in good
health but you should meditate to help
calm your heart rate down too now you
know the benefits let's get into some
simple steps that you can use to get
started tip one start off small as
mentioned spend five minutes a day
closing your eyes and taking long deep
breaths to relax your mind a lot of
people think if you practice breathing
your breathing needs to change or you
need to change it but this isn't the
case breathing naturally five minutes a
day can help you work towards a quieter
mind one once you start off small and
begin to practice over time you'll learn
how to gradually work your way up
remember small progress is still
progress so meditators make sure to take
it one step at a time tip two do what
works for you sometimes meditation for
some people isn't sitting down and
breathing slowly it can be coloring and
being mindful of the present moment this
is known as mindfulness mindfulness lets
you become aware of your surroundings
and your breathing patterns you can do
this by taking a long walk and admiring
the flowers showering with your favorite
body wash or sitting with your best
friend and having a laugh if you don't
want to close your eyes and meditate
mindfulness is a great way to calm and
control your mind but sometimes if
you're struggling with being present and
in the moment you may need to seek out
professional advice and that's where
today's sponsor better help comes in
betterhelp has a powerful mission to
make therapy more accessible and
affordable they're revolutionizing how
we find therapists better help operates
online and can connect you with a
professional therapist in just a few
days simply by filling out a short
questionnaire visit betterhelp.com
Improvement pill or 10 off your first
month finding the right therapist can be
like finding the right meditation
program sometimes you need to switch it
up to get the best results with better
help you can easily change therapists at
no additional cost without stressing
about insurance or networks most people
spend hours in the gym every week so why
not give your mind the same kind of
attention click the link in the
description or visit betterhelp.com
Improvement pill to start your mental
decluttering Journey thanks again to
better help for sponsoring this video
tip 3 Leave Out All expectations we
sometimes think that if we've meditated
for a couple of days or for a whole week
then we'll suddenly have a peaceful mind
but this is not the case many monks and
preachers have taken years to master the
true art of how meditation works we
think meditation can also be about just
sitting quietly and then suddenly your
mind will be at peace however meditation
can bring up some emotions such as
anxiety irritation or nervousness this
is normal and nothing to be worried
about meditating increases your
self-awareness and you will suddenly
become aware of your emotions or
negative behaviors so instead of
thinking that meditation must be a
certain way and you should expect
amazing outcomes in the beginning you
must first understand that meditation
takes practice and you should be ready
to sit in discomfort to truly achieve a
peaceful mindset tip 4 make sure you
enjoy the journey Buddha once said
Delight in meditation and Solitude
compose yourself be happy you are a
Seeker meditation is a chance for you to
become happier mentally and achieve a
calmer mind throughout your meditating
Journey you may experience some ups and
downs but being able to reflect and
enjoy the journey will help you to
become calmer as a person and help you
to work towards mindfulness taking five
minutes out of the day to breathe or
practice mindfulness is a big
achievement and you should enjoy your
meditating Journey along the way I hope
this video was helpful and helped you to
understand the import of meditation
don't forget meditation doesn't just
happen overnight it may take weeks or
months but be thankful you have started
your meditation journey to achieve
mindfulness and a calmer mind make sure
to check out our other videos on how to
meditate for beginners and what are the
seven different types of meditation
until next time
